description: From Middle English acceptable, from Old French acceptable, from Late Latin acceptābilis (“worthy of acceptance”).

adjectives.description: acceptable (comparative more acceptable, superlative most acceptable)

entries.meaning: worthy, decent, sure of being accepted or received with at least moderate pleasure
examples: We need to find an acceptable present for Jeff.

entries.meaning: Barely worthy, less than excellent; passable.
examples: The designs were acceptable, but they were nothing special either.
